title: Trams in Nizhyn
text:
Trams in Nizhyn (, <a href="Romanization%20of%20Ukrainian">translit.</a>: "Nizhynskyi Tramvai") were the part of the <a href="public%20transportation">public transportation</a> system that served <a href="Nizhyn">Nizhyn</a>, a town of the <a href="Chernihiv%20Oblast">Chernihiv Oblast</a>, starting in 1915. The tram system had a <a href="track%20gauge">track gauge</a> of . Horse trams in Nizhyn first opened in 1915. 
The tram system became defunct in the mid-1920s, and never recovered. Information on the number of lines that existed is not available.
